summary: The document is a partially redacted release under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, discussing the implications of CIA covert activities on national security and public perception. It highlights the adverse publicity affecting CIA equities, the frustration stemming from perceived passive U.S. support, and the CIA's role in efforts to change policy.
key_findings: The document is released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It discusses the impact of adverse publicity on CIA equities.
References to CIA covert activities and their implications on national security and public perception are made.
Expresses frustration attributed to perceived passive U.S. support.
Notes the CIA's involvement in efforts to change policy.
